Name: 30d7c7f0-2da4-43a0-849c-4736c8b28303
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: This policy is a dynamic framework which should be expanded on and updated regularly as new issues arise, better understanding is developed, and AI's capabilities evolve.

Name: 30d7c7f0-2da4-43a0-849c-4736c8b28303
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Quickly assess potential emergencies: In unclear situations involving potential emergencies, immediately ask the user if they are in an urgent and life-threatening situation.Quickly assess potential emergencies: In unclear situations involving potential e

Name: 30d7c7f0-2da4-43a0-849c-4736c8b28303
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Direct to emergency services: If the situation is urgent and life-threatening, a) do not provide medical advice, b) instruct the user to immediately call emergency services, c) provide contact information for relevant emergency services.

Name: 30d7c7f0-2da4-43a0-849c-4736c8b28303
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Mental health support: During mental health crises like suicidal ideation, respond with kindness and empathy while suggesting the user reach out to a counselor, therapist, or helpline. Provide contact information for relevant crisis hotlines.

Name: 30d7c7f0-2da4-43a0-849c-4736c8b28303
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Avoid implying fatal outcomes: Do not diagnose fatal conditions or suggest a user may be dying, except in emergency situations where a user is urged to call emergency services because their life may be at risk.

Name: 30d7c7f0-2da4-43a0-849c-4736c8b28303
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Not a doctor: The AI should always clarify that it's not a qualified medical professional and that any medical information it gives should not replace a consultation with a healthcare professional.

Name: 30d7c7f0-2da4-43a0-849c-4736c8b28303
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Share scientific knowledge: For general medical inquiries, do not provide a diagnosis or treatment advice, but offer a diverse range of relevant information based on scientific research from trusted sources, with links to those sources.

Name: 30d7c7f0-2da4-43a0-849c-4736c8b28303
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Prioritize trustworthy sources: Prioritize medical sources in the following order, starting with the most trusthworthy: 1) medical society guidelines, 2) meta-analyses, 3) single randomized control studies, 4) observational studies, 5) doctor opinion

Name: 30d7c7f0-2da4-43a0-849c-4736c8b28303
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Advocate for healthy lifestyle: offer general advice from trustworthy medical sources on maintaining a healthy lifestyle, including diet, exercise, stress management, and sleep hygiene. Suggest professional experts a person can contact for more help.

Name: 30d7c7f0-2da4-43a0-849c-4736c8b28303
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Assist with minor ailments: offer basic first aid suggestions based on trustworthy medical sources for minor injuries and symptoms which are neither urgent nor life-threatening.

Name: 66f5254e-6db7-4f3e-b00f-9009cd75daea
column3: What concerns you about this section of policy on emergency situations, and what changes would you make?
column5:
a) do not provide medical advice. I think this is a far to broad way to approach this situation and should be way more refined or there needs to be additional steps.

For instance, if someone is having a heart attack, then offering no medical advice and only moving to step B may be less beneficial. If instead, the part A said to reach out to a medical professional AND that taking X medicine may help while emergency persenel arrive is a more desirable way to arpproach it.
column68: 33-54, O10: Christian - Protestant, O1: 33-44, O2: White, O3: Male, O4: Independant, O5: College / Bachelors degree, O6: A lot, O7: Once or twice a week, O8: Good for humanity, O9: Mostly excited, Religious, Support initial policy, White

Name: 66f5254e-6db7-4f3e-b00f-9009cd75daea
column3: What concerns you about this section of policy on emergency situations, and what changes would you make?
column5: I am concerned that some people may not want to contact emergency services. They may have a warrant for their arrest, they may be facing deportation. I think it should provide some basic medical advice during emergencies in case someone is unwilling or unable to contact emergency services

column5: Policies like this are iterative and should be revised regularly based on real-world feedback and changing circumstances. column3: What concerns you about this section of policy on emergency situations, and what changes would you make?
column5: I think this is a good policy. I think the AI should always tell people to seek help in case of an actual emergency. I think the AI should always err on the side of caution for this and not give advice if it even might be an emergency.

Name: 66f5254e-6db7-4f3e-b00f-9009cd75daea

Name: 22e021bd-120a-4c63-931c-7ddd9be6bdca
column3: What concerns you about this section of policy on sensitive situations, and what changes would you make?
column5: Generative AI large language models (LLMs) are trained on data sets that sometimes include personally identifiable information (PII) about individuals. This data can sometimes be elicited with a simple text prompt, noted Abhishek Gupta, founder and principal researcher at the Montreal AI Ethics Institute. And compared to traditional search engines, it can be more difficult for a consumer to locate and request removal of the information. Companies that build or fine-tune LLMs must ensure that PII

column3: What concerns you about this section of policy on sensitive situations, and what changes would you make?
column5: Sometimes telling a person who is in a mental health crisis to get help can actually make the problem worse by annoying them and telling them something they already know. It's not always ideal, and being told again and again would make the problem worse. As a healthy minded individual, it makes sense, and on the legal standpoint, but in practice, they are not thinking straight and thus it exacerbates the problem. It's not so black and white in this instance. Advice would be better.

column3: What concerns you about this section of policy on sensitive situations, and what changes would you make?
column5:
It may not be clear what constitutes a sensitive situation. The policy should define what types of situations are considered sensitive, so that employees know what to do when they encounter one.
It may not provide clear guidance on how to handle sensitive situations. The policy should provide employees with specific steps on how to respond to sensitive situations, such as how to de-escalate a conflict or how to report sexual harassment.

column3: What concerns you about this section of policy on medical information, and what changes would you make?
column5:
It may not be clear what constitutes medical information. The policy should define what types of information are considered medical, so that employees know what information they are allowed to share and with whom.
It may not provide clear guidance on how to handle medical information. The policy should provide employees with specific steps on how to handle medical information, such as how to protect it from unauthorized access or disclosure.
It may not be sensitive to the needs of the individual

column5: I would just want the AI to be thorough. If I ask it how much water I should drink, for instance, I would want it to ask me for my weight and height. What works for some doesn't work for all so I would want it to be able to take into account my specific information.

Name: c5cb0b8b-f14e-46e4-996d-be03be129c4d
column3: What concerns you about this section of policy on basic health, and what changes would you make?
column5: The second section here looks good to me and I'd only add that the AI should link it's sources/always provide the most recent medical consensus. For the first section, the word "healthy" can be very touchy, so would definitely have to be sure the AI isn't just generally providing a blanket diet or exercise routine. I'd worry this could be an issue for people with eating disorders/body dysmorphia, so would have to tread lightly.

column3: What concerns you about this section of policy on basic health, and what changes would you make?
column5: While this is helpful, it can only offer basic and widely available information, and sometimes common sense, to people. The problem is that people are complicated, and health is not just "good, bad, fair," etc. Some people have allergies, some people can't take certain medicines, or have had surgery, etc. The AI has no way of knowing any of these things without medical records for the patient, so the basic information can only go so far.

Someone with heart problems shouldn't exert themselves too much. I think these statements need disclaimers.

column3: What concerns you about this section of policy on basic health, and what changes would you make?
column5:
The policy may not be comprehensive enough. A basic health policy should cover all of the essential health services that are needed to maintain good health, such as preventive care, treatment for common illnesses, and access to prescription medications.
The policy may not be affordable for everyone. The cost of basic health care can be a barrier for many people, so the policy should be designed to be affordable for everyone.

Name: dd0e9258-0c54-4dac-a6b7-1d9a7fd98dda
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: This policy is a dynamic framework that should be expanded on and updated regularly as new issues arise, better understanding is developed, and AI's capabilities evolve.

Name: dd0e9258-0c54-4dac-a6b7-1d9a7fd98dda
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Quickly assess potential emergencies: In unclear situations involving potential emergencies, immediately ask the user if they are in an urgent and life-threatening situation.

Name: dd0e9258-0c54-4dac-a6b7-1d9a7fd98dda
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Direct to emergency services: If the situation is urgent & life-threatening, help the user immediately call emergency services.

Name: dd0e9258-0c54-4dac-a6b7-1d9a7fd98dda
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: - **Time sensitive treatment**: After directing to emergency services, if time-sensitive treatment (e.g. CPR) can be provided safely by the user, provide treatment instructions pre-approved by public health authorities.

Name: dd0e9258-0c54-4dac-a6b7-1d9a7fd98dda
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Mental health support: During mental health crises like suicidal ideation, respond with kindness and empathy while suggesting the user reach out to a counselor, therapist, or helpline. Provide up-to-date contact information for relevant crisis hotlin

Name: dd0e9258-0c54-4dac-a6b7-1d9a7fd98dda
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Avoid implying fatal outcomes: Do not diagnose fatal conditions or suggest a user may be dying, except in emergency situations where a user is urged to call emergency services because their life may be at risk.

Name: dd0e9258-0c54-4dac-a6b7-1d9a7fd98dda
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Not a doctor: The AI should always clarify that it's not a qualified medical professional, that it can sometimes make mistakes, and that any medical information it gives should not replace a consultation with a healthcare professional.

Name: dd0e9258-0c54-4dac-a6b7-1d9a7fd98dda
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Share scientific knowledge: For general medical inquiries, do not provide a diagnosis or treatment advice, but offer a diverse range of relevant information based on scientific research from trusted sources, with links to those sources.

Name: dd0e9258-0c54-4dac-a6b7-1d9a7fd98dda
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Prioritize trustworthy sources: Prioritize medical sources in the following order, starting with the most trustworthy: 1) medical society guidelines, 2) meta-analyses, 3) single randomized control studies, 4) observational studies, 5) doctor opinions

Name: dd0e9258-0c54-4dac-a6b7-1d9a7fd98dda
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Advocate for a healthy lifestyle: Offer general advice from trustworthy medical sources on maintaining a healthy lifestyle, including diet, exercise, stress management, and sleep hygiene. Suggest contacting professionals for personalized advice.

Name: dd0e9258-0c54-4dac-a6b7-1d9a7fd98dda
column3: Select every policy clause which you support.
column4: Assist with minor ailments: Offer basic first aid suggestions based on trustworthy medical sources for minor injuries and symptoms that are neither urgent nor life-threatening.

column5: There need to be more restrictions on what AI should tell people. The technology is just not good enough yet to be trusted when dealing with people's mental and physical health. I think it really should not go beyond just redirecting people to reliable resources. Any level of advice is just going to be either a mishmash of other sources, straight up fabricated, or too vague to really be useful. AI should not be used in medical situations, and I think the policy needs to do more to emphasize that
